ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] Greetings
ygData.msgSnippet: Halyburton, You can start your epci at any lvl you choose, I was 60 before I obtained my epic, I felt levels were more important. There are a few powerful
ygData.messageBody:
Halyburton,

You can start your epci at any lvl you choose, I was 60 before I
obtained my epic, I felt levels were more important.

There are a few powerful guilds on my server, one of them worked on a
epic for a shaman twink, this clown achieved shaman epic at lvl 12,
by short circuiting some of the harder fights. Made me real sad as I
worked very hard for mine. Most of the epic is no problem, the major
bottle neck is the tear that drops in fear, this held me up for aprox
6 months.

The best link I have found for shaman specific questions about
anything pretty much is:

www.eqshaman.com

Hope this helps.

Kamorm



--- In theeverquesttavern@y..., "Claude P Perry II"
<carmacculloch@e...> wrote:
> Hail and Well met Kamorm,
>
> I have a 32 Barb Shammy and I am wondering when can I start my
Epic? And
> aside from hunting the HG in RM where can I go to get good xp and
cash so I
> can finance my Alchemy materials as well as save up for spells and
such?
> Also what are the Ancient Scrolls? and when can they be gone after?
>
>
> Halyburton Bearhugger 32 Barb Shammy
> Qapmoc 11 Half Elf Ranger
> Doktari 7 High Elf Cleric
> Defender of the Faith
> Saryn
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "John" <kamorm@i...>
>
>
>
> > Hail,
> >
> > I have been at this stoopid game for close to 3 years. My crowning
> > achievement so far (150 days played, cause I love to 'smell the
> > flowers') is lvl 60 epiced shaman with complete spellbook
> > (no 'Ancient Scrolls' yet) and 25 AA pts. Even after playing EQ
for
> > this amount of time there is so much I am unfamiliar with, mostly
the
> > old world, feel like newbie often :)
> >
> > I do however have humble knowledge of the Barbarian Shaman class,
the
> > continent of Antonica and many of the kunark and velious zones. I
> > hang out mostly in luclin zones atm. I belong to a smallish guild
(60
> > members) that I have been in for 2 years (since early 30's) we are
> > just now approaching some of the higher end encounters.
> >
> > I know I will learn from you folks and hopefully be able to
> > contribute in some humble manner.
> >
> > Kamorm Winterstalker
> > Oralce of Coinfist
> > Innoruuk Server
> >
>
